meanings.definition: To have too few personnel for a particular task or duty.
meanings.sent1: The team was undermanning the project, causing delays.
meanings.sent2: The company often undermannings its customer service department.
meanings.sent3: The undermanning of the kitchen staff led to a comical mix-up of orders.
meanings.sent4: The ship undermanning its crew faced rough seas alone.
meanings.sent5: Undermanning the security detail left the building vulnerable to intruders.

meanings.definition: The act of not having enough staff or workers for a job or task.
meanings.sent1: The undermanning of the construction site resulted in slow progress.
meanings.sent2: Undermanning in hospitals can impact patient care.
meanings.sent3: The undermanning of the circus performers made for a chaotic show.
meanings.sent4: The undermanning of the farm workers left crops unharvested.
meanings.sent5: The undermanning of the police force made the city less safe.
